intro: Daucus maritimus subsp. serratus, commonly known as the serrated sea holly, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the Mediterranean. It is characterized by its narrow, serrated leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant thrives in saline and sandy soils, often found in dunes and coastal scrub habitats. Its structure is adapted to withstand strong winds and salt spray, making it a resilient species. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal ecosystems and supporting pollinators.
